intro: Aeschynomene purpusii, commonly known as the slender sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its slender stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in spikes, which are followed by pods that contain several seeds. Aeschynomene purpusii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade conditions. It is also known for its potential use in phytoremediation due to its ability to accumulate heavy metals.
